column2: Named Entity Recognition (NER) is a critical task in Natural Language Processing (NLP) that involves identifying and categorizing entities such as names of persons, organizations, locations, dates, and numerical expressions within a text. In this assignment, you will implement a BiLSTM-CRF (Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory Conditional Random Field) model for Named Entity Recognition.
column3: Implement a BiLSTM-CRF model for Named Entity Recognition using a deep learning framework like TensorFlow or PyTorch, preprocess the data, train the model, evaluate its performance, conduct error analysis, summarize findings, and submit the code with a brief report.

column2: In this Natural Language Processing (NLP) assignment, you will delve into sentiment analysis, a fundamental task in NLP. Sentiment analysis involves determining the sentiment expressed in a piece of text, which could be positive, negative, or neutral. Specifically, you will be working with a dataset consisting of movie reviews and your task will be to build a sentiment classifier that can accurately predict the sentiment of a given review.
column3: Submit in PDF Format. Max 10 pages content.

column2: In this Natural Language Processing (NLP) assignment, you will delve into sentiment analysis, a fundamental task in NLP. Sentiment analysis involves determining the sentiment expressed in a piece of text, which could be positive, negative, or neutral. Specifically, you will be working with a dataset consisting of movie reviews and your task will be to build a sentiment classifier that can accurately predict the sentiment of a given review.
column3: Submit in PDF Format. Max 10 pages content.

column2: In this Natural Language Processing (NLP) assignment, you will delve into text summarization, a crucial task in NLP that involves condensing a given piece of text into a shorter version while preserving its key information. Specifically, you will explore the use of Transformer-based models, which have shown remarkable performance in various NLP tasks, for the task of abstractive text summarization.
column3: Submit your assignment in PDF, a detailed report outlining your methodology, experimental results, and conclusions.

column1: Text Classification using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
column2: In this assignment, you will explore the application of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for text classification, a fundamental task in NLP. You will utilize a dataset consisting of text documents along with their corresponding labels, and your goal will be to build a CNN model capable of accurately classifying the documents into predefined categories.
column3: Implement a CNN model for text classification using a deep learning framework such as TensorFlow or PyTorch. Preprocess the text data, design the CNN architecture including convolutional layers, pooling layers, and fully connected layers, train the model on the dataset, evaluate its performance using appropriate metrics, and submit the code along with a brief report summarizing the methodology and results.

column1: Named Entity Recognition with Transformer-Based Models
column2: Named Entity Recognition (NER) is an essential NLP task involving the identification and categorization of named entities within text data. In this assignment, you will explore the use of Transformer-based models for NER. You will work with a dataset containing annotated text data and implement a Transformer-based NER model to accurately label named entities.
column3: Implement a Transformer-based NER model using a pre-trained transformer architecture such as BERT or RoBERTa. Preprocess the text data, fine-tune the transformer model on the dataset, evaluate its performance using standard NER evaluation metrics, analyze the results, and submit the code along with a brief report detailing the methodology and findings.

column1: Sentiment Analysis with Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)
column2: Sentiment analysis involves determining the sentiment expressed in a piece of text, which can be positive, negative, or neutral. In this assignment, you will explore the use of Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) for sentiment analysis. You will work with a dataset containing text reviews and their corresponding sentiment labels, and your task will be to build an RNN model to predict sentiment.
column3: Implement an RNN model for sentiment analysis using a deep learning framework such as TensorFlow or PyTorch. Preprocess the text data, design the RNN architecture including recurrent layers, train the model on the dataset, evaluate its performance using appropriate evaluation metrics, and submit the code along with a brief report summarizing the methodology and results.

column2: Text summarization involves condensing a piece of text into a shorter version while retaining its key information. In this assignment, you will explore Sequence-to-Sequence (Seq2Seq) models for text summarization. You will work with a dataset containing articles or documents along with their corresponding summaries, and your goal will be to build a Seq2Seq model capable of generating concise summaries.
column3: Implement a Seq2Seq model for text summarization using a deep learning framework such as TensorFlow or PyTorch. Preprocess the text data, design the Seq2Seq architecture including encoder and decoder components, train the model on the dataset, evaluate its performance using suitable evaluation metrics, and submit the code along with a brief report outlining the methodology and experimental results.

column1: Topic Modeling using Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA)
column2: Topic modeling is a technique for discovering abstract topics within a collection of documents. In this assignment, you will explore Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA), a popular topic modeling algorithm. You will work with a dataset containing a corpus of text documents and implement LDA to uncover latent topics present in the documents.
column3: Implement Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) for topic modeling using a library such as Gensim or Scikit-learn. Preprocess the text data, apply LDA to identify latent topics, analyze the generated topics, evaluate the model's coherence, and submit the code along with a brief report summarizing the methodology and insights gained from topic modeling.
